isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Reconditioning - Replacing Fuel Injector Sleeves

note.para: If the fuel injector sleeve is being removed while the engine is in-chassis, place a cup plug in the bore before removal to prevent debris from entering the cylinder bore.

step1.para: Insert the fuel injector sleeve removal tool into the fuel injector bore.
Turn the removal tool to cut threads into the fuel injector sleeve. Remove the tool from the bore.
Install the fuel injector sleeve puller tool into the bore and tighten. Make sure that the puller tool is threaded all the way into the fuel injector sleeve.
Install a slide hammer onto the puller tool. Remove the fuel injector sleeve from the bore.
Use a stiff wire brush to clean deposits and hardened sealant from the fuel injector bore.
Insert a small stiff nylon brush tool into oil gallery for cleaning.
Use compressed air to clean out all fuel and oil galleries of debris.
Inspect installation tool for a bent pilot shaft or any nicks where sleeve will seat

figure.caption: Applying Loctite™620 sealant to fuel injector sleeve

step1.para: Place a new fuel injector sleeve on the end of the installation tool, see cylinder head and valve special service tools.

figure.caption: Installing fuel injector sleeve into bore

step1.para: Apply Loctite® 620 around the outside diameter at the bottom of the sleeve and around the beginning of the taper at the middle of the sleeve.
Install the sleeve and installation tool into the fuel injector bore.
Use a hammer to drive the fuel injector sleeve into the bore. Remove the installation tool when the sleeve is seated.
Use a soft nylon brush to clean the fuel injector sleeve after installation.

Inspect the inside surfaces of the installed fuel injector sleeve. If nicks and scratches are evident, replace the sleeve again. Make sure that the installation tool is not causing such damage. Use a different installation tool, if necessary.
